column4: since I upgraded to Edgy I can't get the video stream on bbc (and other news websites) to show
can anyone help me fixing the websites embeded videos? I tried automatix, and tried to reinstall players and plugins... no joy I must be doing something wrong
ok... I tried removing realplayer and reinstalling it using synaptic and yet it doesn't work
try installing the w32codecs it has in its lists
the codecs do work properly, I can play wmv files and other video/audio files, it's only the firefox plugins that are not working
did you try installing packages totem-mozilla or mozilla-plugin-vlc ?
I have totem-mozilla installed
should I try reinstalling it?
I also have mozilla-plugin-vlc intalled
close firefox, reinstall it and try again. if it doesn't work, close firefox, try the same procedure with the vlc plugin
if that doesn't work, well.. dunno what else to suggest :\
ok savvas, I'll do now and let you know

it didn't work, but while playing around, I change the player to mplayer, and got this error: Video codec 'MS WMV 9 (win32)' is not handled. You might need to install additional plugins to be able to play some types of movies, I checked apt-get install w32codecs, it said it's at the newest version
maybe it's a copyrighted wmv, which i don't think ubuntu supports
the bbc news video are copyrighted?
can you try to play them yourself and let me know plz?
give me the link, i can try :)
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/3681938.stm
best would be to go to http://news.bbc.co.uk/ and select any video
any video in video news
sorry, doesn't work on mine :p i don't think i have any plugins installed though and i really won't because i don't use them a lot
ok thanks anyway
just to note, it used to work on dapper before I upgraded to edgy
